Note: Responsiveness level (Categorical: Alert, Voice, Pain, Unresponsive)
Subcomponents: Facial expression, upper limbs, compliance with ventilation (Numerical/Text)
Subcomponents: Facial expression, body movements, muscle tension, vocalization (Numerical/Text)
Overall ICANS score or specific sub-components (Numerical/Text)
Subcomponents: Facial expression, activity, guarding, physiology, respiration (Numerical/Text)
Subcomponents: Breathing, vocalization, facial expression, body language, consolability (Numerical/Text)
Indicates whether the SAT was performed or not, based on flowsheet data charted by care team.
Evaluates if the patient's sedation levels are increasing, which would be a contraindication for performing the SAT.
Observe for increased intracranial pressure, which is a critical contraindication for the SAT.
Identifies whether the patient has signs of active myocardial ischemia, which would preclude performing the SAT.
Confirms whether neuromuscular blockers (paralytics) are in use. The SAT cannot proceed if the patient is paralyzed
Indicates whether the patient passed or failed the SAT safety screen.
Checks whether the patient is receiving sedative infusions, such as for seizure control or alcohol withdrawal. Sedation for these conditions must be absent for the SAT to proceed.
Determines if the patient is excessively agitated, which would indicate they are not ready to tolerate breathing on their own.
Indicates whether the SBT was performed or not, based on the results of the SBT safety screen.
A text string field to document the reason for SBT failure, if present (e.g., "tachypnea," "acute change in mental status," or "hypoxemia").
Assesses for hypoxia or inadequate oxygen levels (SpO₂ < 88% or FiO₂ ≥ 50%). Sufficient oxygenation is required before the SBT can be conducted.
Monitors for elevated intracranial pressure. Increased pressure is a critical factor for SBT exclusion.
Identifies the absence of spontaneous breathing efforts. If no spontaneous effort is detected, the trial cannot proceed.
Indicates whether the patient passed or failed the SBT safety screen
Evaluate whether the patient is on significant doses of vasopressors (medications used to support blood pressure). High doses can be a sign of hemodynamic instability, preventing the SBT.
